page.title: 03DEVELOPMENT FROM 19th.CENT'Y
page.content: Hurriedly built mineworkers cottages of c.1830 were demolished by stages in the 1960's.Afew late Georgian houses remain,all well built and modernised. Late Victorian and Edwardian terraces are found in ribbon development and in blocks of streets near the main coll- iery sites.In the 1930's an estate of council houses was built in St.Helens. These are being refurbished now.Larger council housing estates have been built in both villages between 1960 and 1980,and in West Auckland a priv- ate housing development was completed in the late 1960's.Council housing forms over half of the residential building in the villages: St.Helens: 200 private,704 council. W.Auckland:706 private,459 council. The E.end of the block has Victorian terraces and 1960's council houses.
